Should you take aspirin for colon or rectal cancer? Dos and don’ts explained
description: Aspirin's role in preventing colorectal cancer is nuanced. While high-risk individuals, including those with unhealthy lifestyles or Lynch syndrome, may significantly benefit, its use carries risks like bleeding. Recent guidelines urge caution, advising against routine use for many due to potential harms and unclear benefits for the general population.

title: Patchwork roads
description: The tragic death of a 20-year-old student after she came under the wheels of a tipper truck while trying to negotiate a pothole in Bengaluru, earlier this week, has raised questions about the quality of roads across the country. In the southern metropolis of Chennai, the state of roads has always been the flashpoint between the residents and the government. R. Aishwaryaa finds that at the core of the issue of poor-quality roads is inadequate coordination between different government departments

title: US judge temporarily blocks Trump admin from deploying National Guard troops in Portland, Oregon
'I don't see Virat, Rohit playing 2027 ODI World Cup'
description: Shubman Gill has been appointed India's new ODI captain for the upcoming Australia tour, replacing Rohit Sharma, with Shreyas Iyer named vice-captain. This leadership transition is seen as a forward-looking move for the 2027 World Cup, as Rohit Sharma steps away from all leadership roles. Experts praise Gill's appointment as crucial for shaping Indian cricket's future.

title: Kantara Chapter 1 box office day 3: Rishab Shetty's film earns over Rs 160 cr
description: Kantara Chapter 1 has emerged as a box office phenomenon, grossing an impressive Rs 162.85 crore net in India over its initial three days. The Rishab Shetty-led prequel shattered records, becoming the highest-grossing Kannada film of the year and surpassing major Indian releases. With significant overseas earnings, the film is proving to be a massive commercial success, captivating audiences globally.

title: Why fibre is protein’s best friend
Is sitting down immediately after a meal worse than smoking for your heart?
57.11 lakh women screened at 25,192 free medical camps in A.P., says Health Minister
description: Apart from blood pressure, diabetes, TB and sickle cell tests, women were screened for cervical, breast and oral cancers, says Satya Kumar

description: Officials say the machines are being installed in 10 more locations, including Broadway, Padi junction, GKM Colony, Kolathur, Tholkappia Poonga, and near Government Stanley Hospital

title: IND vs WI: Bumrah's social media post after 1st test win goes viral
description: India secured an emphatic innings-and-140-run victory over West Indies, extending their unbeaten home streak. Jasprit Bumrah's viral Instagram post, "bayki sab fake hai," celebrated Mohammed Siraj's stellar 4-40 spell, referencing an old meme. Ravindra Jadeja, KL Rahul, and Dhruv Jurel also shone in the dominant win, with the second Test scheduled for October 10.

Government seeks views on including PDS food grains in CPI series
description: The Statistics Ministry has sought views on including free PDS items in the Consumer Price Index compilation, a crucial step during its ongoing revision. This update aims to strengthen the CPI by revising item weights and the consumption basket, with a new base year of 2024. The decision could significantly impact headline inflation and monetary policy.

title: Followed due process in levying ₹54.45 lakh penalty on CPCL: Pollution Control Board
Trinamool highlights NCRB report on low crime rate in Kolkata
description: The BJP leadership in the State, however, disputed the claims of Kolkata being the safest city and claimed that the data provided by the West Bengal government to NCRB is manipulated to present a rosy picture

title: Maharashtra: US national among 3 held for illegal conversion bid in Bhiwandi
description: Bhiwandi police arrested a 58-year-old US national and two local residents for allegedly attempting to convert villagers to Christianity in Chimbipada. The accused, including James Watson on a business visa, reportedly preached during a prayer meet, claiming Hinduism was superstitious and offering miraculous cures. They face charges under new laws and the Foreigners Act for misusing the visa.

title: Bandmate alleges Zubeen was poisoned by manager, organiser
‘Limbs tied’ & left to die: Jeweller murdered in broad daylight in Kolkata
Mark Sanchez arrested after stabbing in Indianapolis as police reveal charges
description: Former NFL quarterback and FOX Sports analyst Mark Sanchez was stabbed in Indianapolis early Saturday, October 4, 2025. Hospitalized with stab wounds, Sanchez, 38, was subsequently arrested, facing three misdemeanor charges including battery and public intoxication. Police confirmed it was an isolated disturbance, not a random attack, while Sanchez remains in stable condition.

title: Mind and body
description: No amount of money can save a body that is going downhill due to a lack of discipline

title: Kolkata again tops NCRB 2023 safety list: TMC lauds data, BJP raises questions over its accuracy
No fee needed for kids' Aadhaar biometric updates till October next year
description: The Unique Identification Authority of India has waived all charges for mandatory biometric updates for children's Aadhaar cards. Effective October 1 for one year, this pro-people measure benefits approximately six crore children. Previously, updates outside specific age windows incurred a Rs 125 fee. Now, all first and second mandatory biometric updates for children aged 5-17 are completely free.

title: Not against love, just afraid
description: Why so many young Indians are hesitating to marry

title: Trevor Zegras shocks NHL fans, calls Quinn Hughes the greatest player ever
description: Philadelphia Flyers forward Trevor Zegras sparked a frenzy by declaring Vancouver Canucks captain Quinn Hughes the “best hockey player of all time,” bypassing traditional legends. Zegras, who shares an off-ice friendship with Hughes, made the bold claim after his move to Philadelphia. This statement underscores how the younger generation redefines hockey greatness through a modern lens.

title: Honey Irani’s driver arrested for misusing fuel cards worth Rs 12 lakh

title: UPSC to Supreme Court: Will release answer key after prelims
description: UPSC has finally agreed to release provisional answer keys immediately after the preliminary examination, bowing to student demands and a Supreme Court directive. This significant move, aimed at enhancing transparency, will allow candidates to raise objections to discrepancies in the paper with supporting sources. Previously, keys were published almost a year later, making corrections difficult.

title: A bridge called sorry
description: An apology does not undo the past, but it disarms bitterness

‘Youth misled by some leaders’: Ladakh chief secretary on Leh violence
'Belong to individuals': Sitharaman launches campaign to return unclaimed fin assets
description: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman launched a three-month nationwide campaign to return Rs 1.84 lakh crore in unclaimed financial assets. These substantial funds, held across banks, RBI, and other institutions, rightfully belong to individuals and families, not the government. The initiative focuses on raising awareness, providing access via RBI's UDGAM portal, and ensuring officials actively help claimants reclaim their forgotten money.

title: CRS, the premier centre for Russian language and literature in India, turns 60
description: Since 1965, alumni of the Centre of Russian Studies have contributed across the domains of diplomacy, academia, defence, Intelligence, and business, with the institute continuing to be in focus in view of the Ukraine crisis

title: Horoscope Today – October 5, 2025: What Do the Stars Hold for Leo, Pisces, Virgo, Aquarius and Taurus Today? Your Complete Astrological Guide
NCRB: West Bengal's jails house the most foreigners
description: Bengal houses the highest number of foreign prisoners in India, with 2,508 inmates, primarily Bangladeshis detained for illegal entry. These foreigners constitute 9% of the state's total prison population, contributing to severe overcrowding at 120% occupancy. Low deportation rates and a large shared border exacerbate the issue, with many being undertrials.

title: What is Nagaland’s job quota issue? | Explained
description: Why is the government relooking its jobs policy? Why are the tribes in the State divided on the policy?

title: Hope speaks a universal language; fight for dignity, democracy same: Rahul in Colombia
description: Artists who use colour as resistance, and students who dream fearlessly inspire me, Rahul Gandhi said

title: Bareilly violence: Marriage hall of Raza aide razed, house sealed
description: A Samajwadi Party delegation, including MPs, was repeatedly stopped from reaching Bareilly to meet families affected by recent communal clashes. This occurred as authorities demolished a marriage hall linked to an aide of an arrested leader, citing violations.

title: Love story that began with a wrong number ended in murder
description: A wrong number call blossomed into a secret affair, culminating in the murder of 30-year-old Sonam in Hardoi two years ago. Sonam, who pressured her married lover Maseedul to marry her, was killed by him, his brother, and father on August 8, 2023. Her skeleton was recovered from a well after two arrests, with Maseedul currently on the run.

title: 6-year-old dies at Jaipur hospital; parents claim boy was given cough syrup at home in Churu
description: The child was suffering from acute brain fever

title: Two killed in septic tank blast at Farrukhabad coaching centre
Why is a spectre of empty classrooms looming? | Explained
description: What has the Supreme Court ruled on the Teachers’ Eligibility Test? How many teachers are likely to be affected? Why has Tamil Nadu sought a review? What does Article 21A lay down? What is the situation in other States? Are minority institutions part of the verdict?

title: Controversy over remarks on Balasaheb Thackeray’s death, Shiv Sena UBT to file defamation case
description: Sena UBT leader Anil Parab said that the claims made by Ramdas Kadam were a figment of imagination and were made to divert attention from the issues being faced by Maharashtra

title: Allahabad High Court refuse interim protection to Sambhal’s Rayan Buzurg Mosque from demolition
description: The mosque management, in its plea, had claimed that the notices issued were in ‘gross violation’ of the Supreme Court’s directions issued last year which mandated adherence to due process before demolition of religious structures

title: Cough syrup tragedy: MP bans Coldrif as kids' death toll rises to 11
description: Eleven children died in MP's Chhindwara from renal failure after consuming cough syrup. A lab report confirmed Coldrif syrup contained 48.6% diethylene glycol, a poisonous industrial chemical. This prompted MP to ban the medicine and other products from its manufacturer, Sresan Pharmaceuticals, while multi-state checks on drug units are now underway.

title: Supreme Court to hear Wangchuk’s wife’s plea on October 6
description: Dr. Gitanjali J. Angmo has asked the apex court to direct the authorities to produce Wangchuk in court

title: Minister Vishwakarma is new Gujarat BJP chief
How is India responding to crowding disasters? | Explained
description: Why did things get out of hand at actor Vijay’s political rally in Tamil Nadu? What are the crowd control protocols in place? Are these measures statutory? Where have the most enforceable initiatives emerged? Should responsibility of managing crowds be fixed on organisers?

title: Taylor Swift fans think she called out Brittany Mahomes over Kim Kardashian's past
description: Taylor Swift's new album, "The Life of a Showgirl," has ignited fan speculation that a track, "Cancelled," targets Brittany Mahomes. This drama resurfaced Mahomes' past work with Kim Kardashian, fueling rumors of a fallout. However, Swift clarified the song addresses her personal experiences with public judgment and scandalous moments, not a specific individual, despite earlier sightings of the two together.

title: Ingesting the wrong variety
description: While there is much debate on malnutrition among the poor with many going without a proper square meal a day, even those who can afford food are not eating the right food

title: India-UK relations: PM Modi to meet Keir Starmer in Mumbai on October 9
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will make his first official visit to India on October 8-9, heading to Mumbai. He and PM Narendra Modi will address the Global Fintech Fest and hold bilateral talks. Their agenda includes reviewing the India-UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership, Vision 2035, and the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement.

title: Nirav Modi case: India may give 'no arrest' pledge to get him extradited
description: Indian agencies will assure a UK court that no new cases will be filed against fugitive Nirav Modi if he is extradited, and he won't face fresh arrests or interrogations beyond existing charges. This submission aims to counter Modi's appeal to reopen his extradition trial, which the UK High Court previously approved. The hearing is set for November 23.

title: Outrage on campus as DU shares video link of V-C speech on ‘Urban Naxalism’ via e-mail
MCD steps up efforts after incidents of dog bite at JLN Stadium
description: Two permanent dog-catching teams stationed at venue; garbage around the stadium attracts strays: MCD official; still in fear, says attacked coach

title: Amid efforts to repair ties, PM Modi again hails Trump's Gaza move
description: PM Modi welcomed President Trump's leadership on the Gaza peace plan after Hamas agreed to release hostages, calling it "decisive progress." This endorsement is crucial for mending strained India-US ties, which saw recent positive developments like resumed trade talks. Future meetings between the leaders remain uncertain, contingent on trade progress and Trump's participation in upcoming summits.

title: Tony Blair | A man of many wars
description: The former British Prime Minister, who implemented the Blair Doctrine of ‘humanitarian interventionism’ by sending British troops to Kosovo in 1999 and to Sierra Leone, and earned public opprobrium for cheerleading the 2003 Iraq war, is set to play a key role in governing Gaza

title: Sir Creek | A marshland of contention
description: The 96-km-long estuary that lies between Kutch and Pakistan’s Sindh is of enormous economic importance, and became a flashpoint following Pakistan’s May 8 strikes against India

title: Mark Kastelic charges at Rangers’ 6'9" Matt Rempe, refuses to flinch
description: Bruins' new forward Mark Kastelic charged Rangers' Matt Rempe in their final preseason game after both left the penalty box. This incident followed earlier physical plays and penalties, showcasing Kastelic's gritty character despite a significant size disadvantage. The fight, deemed a draw, highlighted Kastelic's readiness for tough bottom-six roles ahead of the Bruins' October 2025 season opener.

title: CM, PWD Minister take boat ride to review Chhath Puja preparations
Rajasthan Congress leader Rameshwar Dudi passes away at 62
Paddy coverage in Cauvery delta during current Samba season lower than last year
description: The farmers and officials attribute a number of reasons for this fall, with the main one being the late sowing during the short-term Kuruvai season thanks to the unseasonal spell of rain in February-April this year

title: JNUSU elections likely in November; grievance redressal cell constituted
'Forwarding pro-Pak message not sedition': Allahabad high court grants bail to man
description: The Allahabad High Court granted bail to a Meerut man, Sajid Chaudhary, accused of sharing a "Pakistan zindabad" post. The court observed that merely supporting another country does not constitute endangering India's sovereignty under BNS section 152, though it might fall under promoting enmity. Sajid was charged under BNS section 152 and had been incarcerated since May.

title: Sonam Wangchuk | Ladakh’s engineer of change
description: The education reformer, roped in by Ladakh’s civil society groups to represent their causes, has been arrested under the National Security Act

title: Police deny permission for Palaniswami’s campaign in Namakkal district
description: AIADMK functionaries says the campaign has been postponed to October 8 and 9

title: Govt. employees union urges Chief Minister for 3% Dearness Allowance hike
'Went to build better future': How 'robbery attempt' claimed Indian student's life in US
description: A 28-year-old Hyderabad student, Pole Chandrasekhar, was fatally shot in Texas, US, on October 3 during a suspected armed robbery at his part-time gas station job. Chandrasekhar, who was pursuing a master's, died on the spot. Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy expressed condolences and assured government support to repatriate his remains, with coordination underway with Indian officials.

title: Political rallies and tragedy: from the pages of a novella
description: Vazhga Vazhga, authored by Sahitya Akademi award winner Imayam, is about a crowd that gathers at the election rally of a female politician and the chaos that ensues

NFL trade rumours: Miami Dolphins may trade Tyreek Hill after devastating injury
description: Miami Dolphins star Tyreek Hill, recovering from a severe knee injury and embroiled in a legal scandal, might be released before next season. Reports indicate the Dolphins plan to cut him before his 2026 salary guarantees, despite his manager stating he'll be ready for Week 1. The Pittsburgh Steelers reportedly backed off interest due to his domestic violence allegations.

title: Novak Djokovic net worth: Know about his career, Shanghai Masters update & more
description: Novak Djokovic continues his dominance in 2025, winning matches and accumulating over $190 million in career prize money. His estimated net worth of $240-250 million is bolstered by major endorsements and new business ventures like Joe & The Juice. Still competing at the highest level, he recently returned to the Shanghai Open and secured his 100th career title.

title: Govt. orders detailed probe into Coldrif issue
Savannah James opens up on balancing motherhood, business amid public pressure
description: Savannah James, LeBron James' wife, shares insights into her life. She balances motherhood, a successful business, and supporting her NBA star husband. She spoke about prioritizing family and pursuing passions. Savannah maintains strict privacy regarding her personal life. Her long relationship with LeBron James began in their teenage years. They have overcome many challenges together.

title: Curve on Chambakkara-Petta stretch turns death trap

J&K: Pakistani drone spotted near border village; combing operation on
description: Security forces launched a massive search operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district after a suspected Pakistani drone was spotted hovering over a border village on Friday night. This incident follows two other recent drone sightings in the Ramgarh sector and over a military garrison in early September, raising concerns about potential airdrops.

title: Gabrielle Union opens up on insecurity after job rejection: 'I wanted to be attractive'
description: Hollywood actress Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, recently revealed her deep-seated insecurities about her appearance. On a podcast, she shared how job rejections and early career struggles impacted her self-confidence. Union sought therapy, discovering her "daddy issues" contributed significantly. She confronted her father, who emphasized achievement over looks, shaping her perspective despite her success.

World Para Athletics Championships: Ekta Bhyan wins hat-trick of medals with silver in women’s club throw F51 event
J&K: National Conference to contest all 4 RS seats; ally Congress wants one
description: Jammu and Kashmir's ruling National Conference will contest all four Rajya Sabha seats, refusing to concede any to ally Congress, which seeks at least one. BJP also announced contesting all seats, dismissed by NC. Polling is on October 24 for the long-vacant seats. The NC-Congress alliance holds 53 MLAs in the 88-member assembly, setting the stage for a keen contest.

title: They survived mine blasts. Now, Armymen Soman Rana and Pardeep Rana are World Championship medallists

title: Ladakh: Govt calls Ladakhis peace-loving patriots; dialogue process to start soon
description: The Ladakh government affirmed the Centre's commitment to dialogue with Ladakhi groups, despite recent talks being called off after a September 24 incident involving security forces and protesters. Chief Secretary Pawan Kotwal assured protection of land, resources, and cultural identity, while refuting claims of demographic change or commercial exploitation, emphasizing a carbon-neutral development path.

description: It may also quieten the mounting speculation over his position, even if only temporarily

title: Fatima Sana ahead of IND vs PAK at World Cup: ‘Whatever records exist between India and Pakistan are meant to be broken’
When a ‘fellow traveller’ went to space
description: The successful launch of Sputnik — the world’s first artificial satellite to orbit Earth — on October 4, 1957 rocketed humanity to a hitherto unknown time and space. While the scientific aspects of the success were significant and groundbreaking, it also marked the beginning of the space race between the Cold War foes the Soviet Union and the U.S. A.S.Ganesh takes you back to where it all started…

title: Ajit Agarkar on Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma’s future in ODIs, Ravindra Jadeja’s exclusion and more; full transcript of press conference
Mark Sanchez stabbing: Former New York Jets star brutally attacked in Indianapolis
description: Ex-NFL quarterback Mark Sanchez was stabbed in downtown Indianapolis early Saturday morning, October 4, 2025. Initially in critical condition, FOX Sports confirmed he is now stable and recovering in the hospital. One suspect has been taken into custody following the violent altercation, which occurred while Sanchez was in town for a broadcasting assignment.

Poisoning charges emerge in Zubeen Garg death case
description: The probe into Zubeen Garg’s death has dramatically escalated with fresh poisoning allegations now central to the inquiry. The SIT arrested manager Siddharth Sharma, citing a co-accused's claim that Zubeen was poisoned in Singapore by Sharma and Shyamkanu. A judicial commission has also launched its independent probe, with the CM awaiting the viscera report for truth.

description: Claiming to be police officers, two men told Naresh that they needed to question him and took his bike

title: Bihar elections: BJP seeks 2-phase polls; ally JDU says finish it at one go
description: Bihar's NDA allies, BJP and JD(U), have differing views on the upcoming assembly election schedule. BJP and several parties urged the Election Commission for a maximum of two phases to reduce costs, while JD(U) proposed a single phase, citing good law and order and potential Chhath festival voter participation. The EC is reviewing preparations in Patna.

title: Extremely heavy rainfall batters North Bihar, eastern UP
Man dies while cleaning sewage line in Kolathur
description: Sources in Chennai Metrowater said the incident occurred during ongoing work to replace old machine holes in the sewer network.

title: Debris dumped in Cooum due to elevated corridor work raises flooding risk: residents

title: What is the permissible amount of alcohol that can be consumed without harm
description: Alcohol has long been a part of social and cultural life, but the question of how much is truly safe remains complex. Science shows that alcohol has a biphasic effect — small amounts may offer some cardiovascular benefits, while higher intakes, even occasional, can harm the heart, liver, brain, and overall health. Individual factors like genetics, sex, and metabolism influence how the body processes alcohol, making “safe” levels vary from person to person.

description: A groundbreaking study reveals a surprising link between oral microbes and pancreatic cancer risk. This discovery offers new avenues for early detection through oral microbiome profiling and prevention strategies, urging further research into causation.

Users heavily criticized Musk and the post's flawed logic, emphasizing the stark difference between legal immigration and violent colonial subjugation, and reminding him of historical atrocities.

title: Trump's Gaza plan: Israel prepares for '1st stage'; what is the 20-point proposal?
description: Hamas partially accepted President Trump's peace plan for Gaza, expressing readiness for immediate talks on hostage release and ending the conflict. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu also prepared to implement the plan's first stage. The proposal outlines a deradicalized Gaza, technocratic governance, and a pathway to Palestinian self-determination, with Trump overseeing redevelopment efforts.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; scheduled services will..
description: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years after Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. Despite this, the US Embassy in India confirmed that scheduled visa and passport services will continue. The embassy's X account will only provide urgent safety and security updates during this period.

title: US Army warns: Military network at ‘very high risk’; sends memo to these companies
description: The US Army's chief technology officer issued a memo labeling the new NGC2 battlefield communications network, developed by Palantir and Anduril, as "very high risk" due to fundamental security flaws. Concerns include uncontrolled data access, unmonitored user actions, and unverified software security, potentially allowing adversaries persistent access and misuse of classified information.

title: Gisele Bündchen finds healing in nature and family as ex-husband Tom Brady watches afar
description: Gisele Bündchen, 45, embraces a new chapter, sharing glimpses of her seven-month-old baby boy, life with Joaquim Valente, and her deep connection to nature. Her recent Instagram post highlighted a tender photo of her newborn and a message of mindfulness, showing her grounded lifestyle in Brazil focused on family and healing.
